page.title: 10Village church and chapel
page.content: In 1979, the parish church of St.Peters Charney Bassett, joined with the church of St. Mary the Virgin, Lyford, (together with Longworth and Hinton Waldrist), to form the new parish of Cherbury. At Charney Bassett it is only possible to hold one service each Sunday, so Holy Communion and Evensong are alternated. The services of a priest have to be shared with other churches. There is a small Sunday School with around 10 members. In l985 work started on repairing the roof. The cost is estimated at 40,000 pounds, most of which has been raised with help from the English Heritage Trust. The little chapel at Lyford was almost wholly built during the first half of the 13th century, and is nowadays still used regularly.
